metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: This section explains how to create and manipulate arrays in Bash scripts.
content.html: This section explains how to create and manipulate arrays in Bash scripts.

content.text: Arrays allow you to store multiple values in a single variable, making data management easier.
content.html: Arrays allow you to store multiple values in a single variable, making data management easier.

content.text: To create an array in Bash, use the following syntax.
content.html: To create an array in Bash, use the following syntax.

content.text: Arrays can store multiple values, and each value is indexed starting from zero:
content.html: Arrays can store multiple values, and each value is indexed starting from zero:

content.code_html: my_array=("value1" "value2" "value3")

content.text: Use descriptive names for arrays to indicate their purpose.
content.html: Use descriptive names for arrays to indicate their purpose.

content.text: To access elements in a Bash array, use the index of the element.
content.html: To access elements in a Bash array, use the index of the element.

content.text: The index is specified in square brackets:
content.html: The index is specified in square brackets:

content.code_html: echo ${my_array[0]}

content.text: You can modify elements in a Bash array by specifying the index and assigning a new value:
content.html: You can modify elements in a Bash array by specifying the index and assigning a new value:

content.code_html: my_array[1]="new_value"

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct syntax to create an array in Bash?
content.html: What is the correct syntax to create an array in Bash?
